dataview.account.help.available: Available is your main balance, the VNA you can spend for executing transactions. When you purchase VNA tokens, they are delivered in the available balance.
dataview.account.help.trustDeposit: Trust deposit is the VNA that has been deposited as trust guarantee.
dataview.account.help.claimableInterests: Claimable interests: Your trust deposit is producing yield. You can claim earned yield and transfer it to your available balance.
dataview.account.help.reclaimable: Reclaimable is the VNA that still is in your trust deposit, but has been freed and can be reclaimed. The reclaimable balance is automatically reused for newly needed trust deposit amounts, unless you reclaim it.
dataview.did.fields.years.label: Years
dataview.gfd.fields.creator: Controller
dataview.cs.fields.creator: Controller
dataview.cs.descriptions.issuerPermManag:
defines how permission are managed for issuers of this Credential Schema:
  • OPEN means anyone can create its own ISSUER permission;
  • GRANTOR_VALIDATION means a validation process MUST be run between a candidate ISSUER and an ISSUER_GRANTOR in order to create an ISSUER permission;
  • TRUST_REGISTRY_VALIDATION means a validation process MUST be run between a candidate ISSUER and the trust registry owner in order to create an ISSUER permission.
Choose wisely, as a Credential Schemas is immutable and thus cannot be modified.
dataview.cs.descriptions.verifierPermMan:
defines how permission are managed for verifiers of this Credential Schema:
  • OPEN means anyone can create its own VERIFIER permission;
  • GRANTOR_VALIDATION means a validation process MUST be run between a candidate VERIFIER and a VERIFIER_GRANTOR in order to create a VERIFIER permission;
  • TRUST_REGISTRY_VALIDATION means a validation process MUST be run between a candidate VERIFIER and the trust registry owner in order to create a VERIFIER permission.
Choose wisely, as a Credential Schema is immutable and thus cannot be modified.
dataview.cs.descriptions.issuerGrantorVa: maximum number of days an issuer grantor validation can be valid for, in days. Use 0 so that validation never expires, or set a number of days lower than 3650. Example, if you want a validation process to be valid for one year so that applicant will have to renew the validation process each year, set this parameter to 365.
dataview.cs.descriptions.verifierGrantor: maximum number of days a verifier grantor validation can be valid for, in days. Use 0 so that validation never expires, or set a number of days lower than 3650. Example, if you want a validation process to be valid for one year so that applicant will have to renew the validation process each year, set this parameter to 365.
dataview.cs.descriptions.issuerValidatio: maximum number of days an issuer validation can be valid for, in days. Use 0 so that validation never expires, or set a number of days lower than 3650. Example, if you want a validation process to be valid for one year so that applicant will have to renew the validation process each year, set this parameter to 365.
dataview.cs.descriptions.verifierValidat: maximum number of days a verifier validation can be valid for, in days. Use 0 so that validation never expires, or set a number of days lower than 3650. Example, if you want a validation process to be valid for one year so that applicant will have to renew the validation process each year, set this parameter to 365.
dataview.cs.descriptions.holderValidatio: maximum number of days holder validation can be valid for, in days. Use 0 so that validation never expires, or set a number of days lower than 3650. Example, if you want a validation process to be valid for one year so that applicant will have to renew the validation process each year, set this parameter to 365.
dataview.cs.descriptions.jsonSchema: A basic validation of your Json Schema will be done. Make sure to set the "$id" section to "{{id}}".
datatable.did.description.1: The DID directory is a public database of Decentralized Identifiers (DIDs) that is used by crawlers to index the metadata of the services provided by these DIDs, if they comply with the Verifiable Trust specification. Indexed DIDs are then searchable in search.verana.io and in others Verifiable Trust search engines.
datatable.did.description.2: Any participant can register a DID in the DID directory by executing a transaction in the Verana Network.
messages.MsgAddDID.label: Add DID
messages.MsgAddDID.description: Enter the DID you would like to add to the DID Directory and select the number of registration years. Make sure your DID is resolvable and its DID Document complies with the Verifiable Trust Specification.
messages.MsgAddDID.cost: Based on the selected number of years, you'll need approx. {value} VNA to complete the transaction.
messages.MsgRenewDID.label: Renew DID
messages.MsgRenewDID.description: Select the number of registration years you would like to extend this DID.
messages.MsgRenewDID.cost: Based on the selected number of years, you'll need approx. {value} VNA to complete the transaction.
messages.MsgTouchDID.label: Touch DID
messages.MsgTouchDID.description: "Touching" this DID will force its DID Document to be re-indexed by crawlers. Execute this transaction each time your DID Document has been modified.
messages.MsgTouchDID.cost: You'll need approx. {value} VNA to complete this transaction.
messages.MsgRemoveDID.label: Remove DID
messages.MsgRemoveDID.description: This transaction will remove this DID from the DID Directory. It will not be indexed by crawlers anymore, and should be removed from search engines soon.
messages.MsgRemoveDID.cost: You'll need approx. {value} VNA to complete this transaction. Your corresponding {td} trust deposit will be freed.
messages.MsgReclaimTrustDepositYield.des: Claiming your interests will transfer them to your Main Balance.
messages.MsgReclaimTrustDepositYield.cos: You’ll need approx. {value} VNA to complete this transaction.
messages.MsgReclaimTrustDeposit.label: Confirm
messages.MsgReclaimTrustDeposit.descript: Destructive action! I understand that reclaiming freed trust deposit will transfer {addBalance}% of my reclaimable balance to my main balance and burn the remaining {burnRate}%.
messages.MsgReclaimTrustDeposit.cost: You’ll need approx. {value} VNA to complete this transaction.
messages.MsgRepaySlashedTrustDeposit.cos: There is a {value} VNA fee for repaying slashed deposit.
messages.MsgCreateTrustRegistry.label: Confirm
messages.MsgCreateTrustRegistry.descript: Fill-in this form to create a new Trust Registry. Note that the Governance Framework document URL must be persistent and immutable else Trust Resolution will fail. Fields with a * are mandatory.
messages.MsgCreateTrustRegistry.cost: Click confirm when you are ready. You'll need approx. {value} VNA to complete the transaction.
messages.MsgUpdateTrustRegistry.label: Confirm
messages.MsgUpdateTrustRegistry.descript: You can update the DID, aka, and Primary Governance Framework Language. If you change the Trust Registry DID, make sure the new DID is resolvable and that its DID Document complies with Verifiable Trust specifications.
messages.MsgUpdateTrustRegistry.cost: You’ll need approx. {value} VNA to complete this transaction.
messages.MsgArchiveTrustRegistry.label: Archive Trust Registry
messages.MsgArchiveTrustRegistry.cost: There is no fee for archiving a trust registry.
messages.MsgAddGovernanceFrameworkDocume: Click confirm when you are ready. You'll need approx. {value} VNA to complete the transaction.
messages.MsgIncreaseActiveGovernanceFram: Click confirm when you are ready. You'll need approx. {value} VNA to complete the transaction.
messages.MsgCreateCredentialSchema.label: Confirm
messages.MsgCreateCredentialSchema.cost:
Confirmation
Make sure to check carefully the information as Credential Schemas are immutables. If you made a mistake, you will need to create a new Credential Schema.
Approx. {value} VNA are required to execute this transaction, including trust deposit.
messages.MsgUpdateCredentialSchema.label: Confirm
messages.MsgUpdateCredentialSchema.cost:
Confirmation
Approx. {value} VNA are required to execute this transaction.
messages.MsgArchiveCredentialSchema.cost: There is no fee for archiving a Credential Schema.
